did.unittitle: Walter D. Graham scrapbooks and photo album 1900-1908 1904-1908
did.abstract: Scrapbook and photo albums documenting Graham's life as student and athlete at the University of Michigan.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was received from the Graham family in 1973 (Donor no. 5289)

accruals.p: No further additions to the papers are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright has been transferred to the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Walter D. Graham scrapbooks and photo album, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Walter DeWitt Graham was an engineering student and a guard on the University of Michigan football team, 1904-1907. Graham was born January 23, 1885 in Chicago, Illinois. He attended Hyde Park High School where starred in football and track. At 5'6" and 225 pounds, Graham was one of the heaviest players on the last of Fielding Yost's "point-a-minute," but was also fast for his size. Graham was known by his nickname "Octy", diminutive for Octopus.

Graham was an active participant in campus social life. He was a member of Phi Delta Theta, the Michigamua, Triangle and Vulcans honor societies and active in campus events such the County Fair, minstrel shows, and regularly attended dances, and theatrical and comedy performances. He graduated in 1908 with a degree in mechanical engineering

After graduation Graham returned to Chicago and worked for a number of companies, eventually serving as secretary and treasurer of the Vit-0-Net Manufacturing Company. Graham died July 12, 1927 in River Forest, Illinois.

scopecontent.p: The Graham collection contains rich documentation of athletics and campus life in the first decade of the 20th century. The scrapbook contains clippings of newspaper accounts of football games and other athletic events; programs, posters, and tickets for musical, theatrical events and fraternity activities and variety of student memorabilia

The Photo album contains numerous pictures of the varsity team posed on campus and at pre-season training camp at Whitmore Lake and Ludington. The are many individual photos of players and coaches including Fielding Yost and Keene Fitzpatrick as well as a rare photo of the football training table. There are photos of baseball and track teams and athletes and of push ball and tug-of-war competition between classes. Campus social life documented in photos of J-Hop and other dances, fraternity houses and events, the campus "county fair" and other events including a minstrel show parade with cast members of a production of Uncle Tom's Cabin in which Graham played Little Eva. All of the images are carefully, often humorously, captioned by Graham. He always captioned photos of himself with a question mark.
The second photo album includes a few football images (duplicates of items in the first volume) and the appears to be images of Graham's family and friends.

scopecontent.p: The Scrapbooks series consists of four volumes covering Graham's football and track career at North Division High School, 1901-1904 and the University of Michigan, 1904-1908. Volumes 1-3 are available only on microfilm and consist almost exclusively of newspaper clippings. Volume 4 (a disbound scrapbook includes game programs and posters; postcards, travel lists, menus, etc. from away games; photos; track meet programs, scorecard, and ribbons, as well as some class schedules, grade reports, dance cards, fraternity and class posters, and )

did.unittitle: Volume 1, Chicago, North Division High School, 1901-1904

odd.p: (Includes game programs and posters; postcards, travel lists, menus, etc. from away games; photos; track meet programs, scorecard, and ribbons, as well as some class schedules, grade reports and )

scopecontent.p: The Photo album contains numerous pictures of the varsity team posed on campus and at pre-season training camp at Whitmore Lake and Ludington. The are many individual photos of players and coaches including Fielding Yost and Keene Fitzpatrick as well as a rare photo of the football training table. There are photos of baseball and track teams and athletes and of push ball and tug-of-war competition between classes. Campus social life documented in photos of J-Hop and other dances, fraternity houses and events, the campus "county fair" and other events including a minstrel show parade with cast members of a production of Uncle Tom's Cabin in which Graham played Little Eva. All of the images are carefully, often humorously, captioned by Graham. He always captioned photos of himself with a question mark.
The second photo album includes a few football images (duplicates of items in the first volume) and what appear to be images of Graham's family and friends.
